title: 'They shoot, arrest, extort. It's constant terror': In Sudan, the 'RSF State' as told by those who fled it
subhead: As the threat of Sudan being partitioned looms, the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) claims it could govern Darfur. Those who have managed to escape describe a reign of tyranny and arbitrary rule.

title: Frederik X, a monarch embraced by Greenlanders
Five-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos and his father released from ICE facility in Texas
'A decline in birth rates can help France solve some of its most serious challenges'
subhead: A drop in the number of births can help reduce unemployment, ease housing pressure and improve the education system, argues Guillaume Duval, the former editor-in-chief of 'Alternatives économiques', in an op-ed for Le Monde.

title: Epstein scandal deals new blow to Norway's crown princess
subhead: Newly unsealed files released this weekend exposed Crown Princess Mette-Marit's friendship with the sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The timing could not be worse for Norway's royal palace: On Tuesday, Mette-Marit's 29-year-old son will go on trial to face charges of rape, assault and drug offenses.

title: Infantino, Trump's compliant underling in the lead-up to the 2026 World Cup
subhead: As the threats of the US president run counter to the universal spirit of the 2026 FIFA World Cup, FIFA's president stands out for his complicit apathy, writes Alexandre Lemarié for Le Monde.

title: France faces a crossfire of Russian and American disinformation
subhead: Since the start of the year, pro-Russian networks and Trump-aligned accounts have increasingly targeted France. While their methods differ, they pose an unprecedented challenge.

Who's running in the Paris mayoral election?
subhead: Six main candidates are vying to succeed Mayor Anne Hidalgo, who is not running for re-election, in the municipal elections on March 15 and 22.

title: Switzerland's ill-prepared army faces new global disorder
subhead: Despite maintaining military conscription and an extensive network of fortifications, the country remains under-equipped to address current threats such as missile or drone attacks.

title: Social media ban for under-15s: Why everyone in France will soon have to verify their age
subhead: If the bill is adopted on schedule, all social media users in France will have to undergo age verification before the end of the year.

The duty of solidarity with the Iranian people
Zaki Laïdi, political scientist: 'In 2025, building spheres of influence is infinitely more difficult than during the Cold War'
